title: Joe Giudice is greeted with another 'Welcome to Italy' party after returning home
text:
Joe Giudice has touched down in his home country of Italy.

And while he may not be returning home for the best of reasons, his family was there to greet him over the weekend with a large cake that said 'Welcome to Italy', food, and a DJ.

The 46-year-old reality star returned to Italy after requesting that the ICE detention facility release him while he fights his deportation case.

Welcome home party! Joe Giudice is still celebrating his arrival back to Italy with another celebration with his friends and family hosted by his cousin

Coming back: The reality star returned to Italy after requesting that the ICE detention facility release him while he fights his deportation case

In the photo, a slim-looking Joe smiles in between his friends and family at a party that was organized by his cousin Agostino Lacava.

He seemed to be in good spirits while next to his mother Filomena, brother Pete and sister Maria.

Over the weekend, during a Watch What Happens Live special, Joe videoed in for a special segment with his wife Teresa, 47.

Family time: He seemed to be in good spirits while next to his mother Filomena, brother Pete and sister Maria

'I want the best for him. I want him to happy and I want him to be successful. But I don't know if we could stay together, him living across the country,' she said while on the show in the United States.

Teresa is expected to go to Italy and visit him along with the couple's four daughters, Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 13, and Audriana, 10, which will be filmed for The Real Housewives of New Jersey.

'I don't see it working,' she revealed to the host.

A cake! He was welcomed with a large cake that said 'Welcome to Italy' in Italian

Family: Joe posed with a family member while celebrating his arrival back to Italy

'I think they get it. I don't think they want to see it happen, obviously, but I think they understand,' the mother-of-four revealed about how her daughters are handling the situation.

'Because the way I explained it to them, how are we going to live apart? I don't think he would be faithful. I think he would have someone there and have me here. I just don't want to live that life. I just don't.'

'It's been three and a half years. If I wanted to be with somebody, I could be with somebody this week,' he said of his wife of 20 years' comment. 'That's not what I'm looking to do.'

He continued: 'Listen, as long as she's happy, that's all that really matters. I'm not going to tell her what to do. If she doesn't feel like she wants to be with me anymore, then that's the thing to do.'

She went on to say she hasn't seen him in almost four years but Joe swooped in with a pure and sweet moment saying he still loves his wife.

'Of course, she's my wife. I've been with her a long time. No matter what happens, I'll always love her.'

Talking it out: Joe and his wife Teresa met via video chat on Watch What Happens where they spoke about the fate of their marriage
